references.reason: ShapeNet is a foundational dataset for 3D models and part annotations, serving as a base for many articulated object studies.

references.paper_title: PartNet: A large-scale benchmark for fine-grained and hierarchical part-level 3D object understanding
references.reason: PartNet provides large-scale part annotations with hierarchical semantic information, directly influencing subsequent work on articulated object understanding.

references.paper_title: SAPIEN: A simulated part-based interactive environment
references.reason: SAPIEN is a part-based interactive environment crucial for simulation and evaluation, enabling the assessment of physical properties of generated articulated objects.

references.paper_title: Infinite Photorealistic Worlds using Procedural Generation
references.reason: Infinigen serves as the base for procedural content generation framework, that is later modified in this work to generate realistic scenes.
CAGE is a recent work on controllable articulation generation that allows the authors to improve upon this approach and compare results.
